snippet.textDisplay: Anthem had so much potential to be what Destiny tried so hard to be; a super fun Looter-Shooter set in massive maps brimming with life and dynamic events, with a plethora of different enemy types each unique with their own design, weapons, fighting tactics, homeworld, etc, a vast arsenal of weapons, armor, and other loot of different tiers, plus an engaging storyline filled with memorable characters developed to feel alive, complex and three dimensional; a game worthy of the Bioware we all knew and loved to make it a truly immersive experience to be remembered. Yet, they miserably shattered the high expectations that they had set for this game, failing to deliver even the bare minimums of a looter-shooter, continuously disappointing devout fans who kept playing despite major issues and outright destroying their own prestige as a good studio. IF they want to revive this game, they should completely shut it down, work on it for another 6 months or so, put in all the stuff they took out to sell later, deliver on some of their false promises, add in more features, and relaunch it free of charge for the people who have already bought the game and supported the developers. But what do they do? They proudly say that they have been working "hard" on a dead game, keeping it online as an abomination of GAAS, hoping to make a few more bucks while they sweat-talk players to come back and play more because guess what? Good things are coming. No, Thank you. I for one would rather spend my time on games that are worth it; games from developers that actually respect the community and not see them as a giant colony of dumb, walking and breathing ATMs who will buy whatever garbage you throw at them.
snippet.textOriginal: Anthem had so much potential to be what Destiny tried so hard to be; a super fun Looter-Shooter set in massive maps brimming with life and dynamic events, with a plethora of different enemy types each unique with their own design, weapons, fighting tactics, homeworld, etc, a vast arsenal of weapons, armor, and other loot of different tiers, plus an engaging storyline filled with memorable characters developed to feel alive, complex and three dimensional; a game worthy of the Bioware we all knew and loved to make it a truly immersive experience to be remembered. Yet, they miserably shattered the high expectations that they had set for this game, failing to deliver even the bare minimums of a looter-shooter, continuously disappointing devout fans who kept playing despite major issues and outright destroying their own prestige as a good studio. IF they want to revive this game, they should completely shut it down, work on it for another 6 months or so, put in all the stuff they took out to sell later, deliver on some of their false promises, add in more features, and relaunch it free of charge for the people who have already bought the game and supported the developers. But what do they do? They proudly say that they have been working "hard" on a dead game, keeping it online as an abomination of GAAS, hoping to make a few more bucks while they sweat-talk players to come back and play more because guess what? Good things are coming. No, Thank you. I for one would rather spend my time on games that are worth it; games from developers that actually respect the community and not see them as a giant colony of dumb, walking and breathing ATMs who will buy whatever garbage you throw at them.

snippet.textDisplay: I had high expectations and excitement when I preordered this game a year ago. It obviously turned out to be a super disappointing experience. I probably played anthem for a week and put it away. If I am going to play anthem again there better be some amazing and completely free!! New content. I believe what this game needs is a completely and thought out new loot system and weapons. Aerial and underwater combat/exploration. More enemy types. And more map and biomes added to the game. The sad thing is there is so much potential for this game and it could’ve been the game that ended my social life for a year. Fantastic idea, incredibly poor execution be EA. Make something exciting like giant sea monsters that come out of the water! Or make some crazy pterodactyls flying around to kill. And lord have mercy make good item drops for those enemies. P.S get rid of that annoying wind turbulence crap if you fly like 100 ft in the air, this is 2020 let people fly as high as they want!!
snippet.textOriginal: I had high expectations and excitement when I preordered this game a year ago. It obviously turned out to be a super disappointing experience. I probably played anthem for a week and put it away. If I am going to play anthem again there better be some amazing and completely free!! New content. I believe what this game needs is a completely and thought out new loot system and weapons. Aerial and underwater combat/exploration. More enemy types. And more map and biomes added to the game. The sad thing is there is so much potential for this game and it could’ve been the game that ended my social life for a year. Fantastic idea, incredibly poor execution be EA. Make something exciting like giant sea monsters that come out of the water! Or make some crazy pterodactyls flying around to kill. And lord have mercy make good item drops for those enemies. P.S get rid of that annoying wind turbulence crap if you fly like 100 ft in the air, this is 2020 let people fly as high as they want!!

snippet.textDisplay:
I still play Anthem. I don't have time to play games that eat up too much time anymore. I need something I can pick up play and put down. 1 or 2 events and I'm done for some days. The game is better than before, on rare occasion a load failure happens. Game mechanics are top notch. The thing is we become OP in Anthem and the whole hover and dodge thing with God roll weapons kills off the challenge even on GM3. I don't know what Anthem plans on doing with the guardian tokens, I have 22 of those left, which means I can pull 22 Legendary items of any type of my choosing with the highest power level of 80. I'm not enthusiastic about getting anymore weapons or gear the game has to offer as I'm already a God and I crave more challenge.


As for some of the comments in this section. I don't see what's good about knocking people who bought Anthem or still play it. That shit's spoiled and in the real world being seen that way is the road to poverty.
snippet.textOriginal:
I still play Anthem. I don't have time to play games that eat up too much time anymore. I need something I can pick up play and put down. 1 or 2 events and I'm done for some days.  The game is better than before, on rare occasion a load failure happens. Game mechanics are top notch. The thing is we become OP in Anthem and the whole hover and dodge thing with God roll weapons kills off the challenge even on GM3. I don't know what Anthem plans on doing with the guardian tokens, I have 22 of those left, which means I can pull 22 Legendary items of any type of my choosing with the highest power level of 80. I'm not enthusiastic about getting anymore weapons or gear the game has to offer as I'm already a God and I crave more challenge.


As for some of the comments in this section. I don't see what's good about knocking people who bought Anthem or still play it. That shit's spoiled and in the real world being seen that way is the road to poverty.

snippet.textDisplay: The last time I played this game was when the update that was rolled out reduced one of the loading screens while at the home base... I remember getting in, checking out that load time, and then I got off and never went back. I am really curious to hear from someone about how things went after that. I almost want to check it out myself but I don't want to re-download the game again.

snippet.textDisplay: I don't know man, i really enjoyed this game. It was short, but the feeling of javelin heaviness and gunfight was really good. I think this game could more than a 6 hour story. Hope Bioware will figure out how to resolve this problem and deliver the rest of the story with more content than this open world playground is right now. Wish them good luck!
snippet.textOriginal: I don't know man, i really enjoyed this game. It was short, but the feeling of javelin heaviness and gunfight was really good. I think this game could more than a 6 hour story. snippet.textDisplay: I’ll give it a go cuz I just think the beautiful dynamics of the world of anthem needs a upgrade doing something more than just swim underwater... better weapons better crafting mods ... the ending of a mission is a joke and last but not least... moving striders  ....... here’s an idea make striders like a mobile base that can invite other players to start missions or planning attacks or defend against a horde of dominion invasion...... I could go on ... not a fan boy but a fan of seeing comebacks... if BioWare pulls this off ... it will be a story to tell for sure... good luck 👍

snippet.textDisplay: I was there for the closed beta, the open beta, launch with its 8-10 hr server BS, the freezes in the long loading screens, the re-spawn glitches, the boss de-spawn bugs, all the time wasted grinding for better gear....3 weeks after launch, I jumped ship. I’ve recently tried it out again. Bugs are fixed, everything is how it should’ve been at launch or sometime after launch. There’s no content, no thrill in it, especially for us “Legion of the Dawn” owners.
snippet.textOriginal: I was there for the closed beta, the open beta, launch with its 8-10 hr server BS, the freezes in the long loading screens, the re-spawn glitches, the boss de-spawn bugs, all the time wasted grinding for better gear....3 weeks after launch, I jumped ship. I’ve recently tried it out again. Bugs are fixed, everything is how it should’ve been at launch or sometime after launch. There’s no content, no thrill in it, especially for us “Legion of the Dawn” owners.

snippet.textDisplay: i noticed a change in loading screens and loot drop as well as the world events in free roam but i still feel like the game is incomplete. Not only have they yet to add any durable content after cataclysm. But the ending seemed so simple and lack luster that it was really just kinda meh. I understand it goes based off difficulty but i always felt like important end game or boss fights are supposed to surpass difficulty just a bit. Like easy would be medium, medium would be hard, hard would be expert as far as the boss fights etc. But like even the "raids" need a rework because with a decent group they can be done in just a few minutes it doesn't even feel like anything was accomplished. I feel like the existing content is more focused towards new players that i still see coming in where as there is still nothing existing as of yet for older players to keep us satisfied and that definitely needs to be changed and by changed i mean actually added.

snippet.textDisplay:
Dudes are we still whining about Anthem? Are we actually complaining that a company is trying to improve their product? Are we complaining that they are trying to recoup on an investment? You want people to move on, but who is going to let you move on to anything else important after such a colossal release failure with out improving it, gaining an overall return profit before moving on? If i was a developer, i wouldnt want to move on without being given an opportunity to redeem my name under this Anthem title. Why do you care how much they apologize or not, so long as they put out a great product.

Have any of you played the game currently to criticize the player base and current content, or are you going based totally off the release content and experience.

If you are upset because the game was a great disappointment, i understand that, but why hate on the game being focused on by those that have a love and financial interest in it. If you dont care about Anthem, simply ignore it.

Sounds like the guy on the far right wants and already has a mind set to not even play the game 1st; he wants to stream right away so he can rip on anything he doesn't like about the game live across the internet. Where as Joe at least wants to try 2.0 out 1st. This other guy just has so much hate for Anthem, its very existence is opening old wounds or something. Did he catch Anthem in bed with his wife, and she loved it more than him or something? Damn! 😋

I did go back to Anthem and notice improvements on the game, but didnt stay not because i hated the game, but because i had moved on actually. Anthem ain't the 1st let down when it comes to any purchased media, it already aint the last. But that one guy on your panel needs some closure or something.

Both Joes 👍
snippet.textOriginal:
Dudes are we still whining about Anthem? Are we actually complaining that a company is trying to improve their product? Are we complaining that they are trying to recoup on an investment? You want people to move on, but who is going to let you move on to anything else important after such a colossal release failure with out improving it, gaining an overall return profit before moving on? If i was a developer, i wouldnt want to move on without being given an opportunity to redeem my name under this Anthem title. Why do you care how much they apologize or not, so long as they put out a great product.

Have any of you played the game currently to criticize the player base and current content, or are you going based totally off the release content and experience.

If you are upset because the game was a great disappointment, i understand that, but why hate on the game being focused on by those that have a love and financial interest in it. If you dont care about Anthem, simply ignore it.

Sounds like the guy on the far right wants and already has a mind set to not even play the game 1st; he wants to stream right away so he can rip on anything he doesn't like about the game live across the internet. Where as Joe at least wants to try 2.0 out 1st. This other guy just has so much hate for Anthem, its very existence is opening old wounds or something.  Did he catch Anthem in bed with his wife, and she loved it more than him or something? Damn! 😋

I did go back to Anthem and notice improvements on the game, but didnt stay not because i hated the game, but because i had moved on actually. Anthem ain't the 1st let down when it comes to any purchased media, it already aint the last. But that one guy on your panel needs some closure or something. 

Both Joes 👍

snippet.textDisplay: If they want to save a game and get some ROI, why not complete Mass Effect Andromeda? That game is better than Anthem in every way and it could actually be good with some tweaks to make the quests shorter and less repetitive, the already promised Quarian Ark DLC and a flying vehicle to make navigating the maps less tedious. Even just making all fast travel locations unlocked from the start so that you don't have to spend hours Death Stranding across the maps would make the game much better.
snippet.textOriginal: If they want to save a game and get some ROI, why not complete Mass Effect Andromeda? That game is better than Anthem in every way and it could actually be good with some tweaks to make the quests shorter and less repetitive, the already promised Quarian Ark DLC and a flying vehicle to make navigating the maps less tedious. Even just making all fast travel locations unlocked from the start so that you don't have to spend hours Death Stranding across the maps would make the game much better.

snippet.textOriginal: The most important part of that article was they didn't apologize to the customers that got screwed out of their money. Nope won't be giving this game another chance Bioware has proven time and again that they lost what made them great since EA bought them. The things they say they want to fix should have been in the game from the very beginning, not a year after.  EA can pound sand I won't be buying anything they are selling, especially not from Bioware.

snippet.textDisplay:
I’m so uninterested in this god awful game. BioWare are delusional if they think they’ll attract new players or bring back players who’ve left.
This has to be a PR exercise, some sort of damage limitation by BioWare in order to salvage their reputation.
BioWare would be better returning to the fantastic RPGs with rich universes and characters that made them a beloved developer in the first place.

snippet.textDisplay:
one of my favorite improvements so far, is the stuff provided by the winter event which is: u can spend the seasonal currency and get legendary/masterwork armor, and more cosmetics. Its really easy to get the currency. There are no new strongholds. and no new areas to explore really.
I'm also really sad that i didn't play during Halloween to get the mass effect themed armor for the javelins.
snippet.textOriginal:
one of my favorite improvements so far, is the stuff provided by the winter event which is: u can spend the seasonal currency and get legendary/masterwork armor, and more cosmetics. Its really easy to get the currency. There are no new strongholds. and no new areas to explore really.
I'm also really sad that i didn't play during Halloween to get the mass effect themed armor for the javelins.

snippet.textDisplay: They improved the loot system to the point were you can choose what type of legendary you want to get (ranger parts,other javelin part, weapons) you get them a lot more as a drop and you can use  event currency to buy packs with legendary gear only, They did put more mission in that require puzzle solving so mission became better than the 3-4 original missions you had(protect,gather,kill) cosmetic got better since they put a lot of items behind achievement so doing the event was worth it, but at the same time the shop is bad as it was they need to take some pages from their mmo swtor on that, and crafting got worst since there is no point on using it other than craft combat boosters, story had some development but not much and they didn't do anything to promote clans on the game so finding the right people to do achievement run of big score runs was very difficult and people only managed that through discords.
snippet.textOriginal: They improved the loot system to the point were you can choose what type of legendary you want to get (ranger parts,other javelin part, weapons) you get them a lot more as a drop and you can use  event currency to buy packs with legendary gear only, They did put more mission in that require puzzle solving so mission became better than the 3-4 original missions you had(protect,gather,kill) cosmetic got better since they put a lot of items behind achievement so doing the event was worth it, but at the same time the shop is bad as it was they need to take some pages from their mmo swtor on that, and crafting got worst since there is no point on using it other than craft combat boosters, story had some development but not much and they didn't do anything to promote clans on the game so finding the right people to do achievement run of big score runs was very difficult and people only managed that through discords.
